what: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: goal survode implement method described Tang et al. (2022) [1] fitting survival models using ordinary differential equations. package currently development yet ready use.

title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: can install development version survode like :

title: Survival Analysis via Ordinary Differential Equations
text: basic example shows solve common problem: [1] Tang, W. et al. (2022) ‘Survival analysis via ordinary differential equations’, Journal American Statistical Association, pp. 1–16. Available : https://doi.org/10.1080/01621459.2022.2051519.

what: Ancillary arguments for controlling survode fitting — survode.control
title: Ancillary arguments for controlling survode fitting — survode.control
Ancillary arguments for controlling survode fitting — survode.control
Ancillary arguments for controlling survode fitting — survode.control
text: eps convergence criteria optimization algorithm. Default 1e-4. maxit maximum number iterations optimization algorithm. Default 100.

what: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survode
title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survode
text: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations

title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survode
code: survode(formula, data, df, degree = 3, knots = "uniform", init, control)

title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survode
text: formula formula object, response left ~ operator, terms right. response must survival object returned Surv function. data data frame interpret variables named formula. df number degrees freedom spline. degree degree spline. Default 3. knots knots spline, either "uniform" "quantile". "uniform", knots equally spaced 0 maximum observed time. "quantile", knots equally spaced quantiles observed times. Default "uniform". init vector initial values parameters. Default initial value zero parameters. control Object class survode.control containing control parameters fitting algorithm. Default survode.control().

title: Fit Survial Models via Ordinary Differential Equations — survode
code: library(survival) library(simsurv) # Create a simple data set set.seed(42) cov <- data.frame(id = 1:100, trt = stats::rbinom(100, 1L, 0.5)) dat <- simsurv(   lambdas = 0.1, gammas = 1.5, betas = c(trt = -0.5),   x = cov, maxt = 5 ) sim1 <- merge(cov, dat) # Fit a Cox model with a spline for the baseline hazard survode(Surv(eventtime, status) ~ trt, data = sim1, df = 5) #> Warning: Special controls present for optimr with method snewton #> $coefficients #> $coefficients$gamma #> $coefficients$gamma$alpha #>         1         2         3         4         5  #> -1.834404 -2.093552 -1.482093 -1.551095 -1.410844  #>  #> $coefficients$gamma$knots #> [1] 2.5 #>  #> $coefficients$gamma$Boundary.knots #> [1] 0 5 #>  #> $coefficients$gamma$degree #> [1] 3 #>  #>  #> $coefficients$beta #>              #> -0.09487091  #>  #>  #> $var #>            [,1]        [,2]       [,3]       [,4]        [,5]      [,6] #> [1,] 26.6620485 -6.43550019  0.9032182  2.2788794  2.38184648 -3.750873 #> [2,] -6.4355002 14.61398082  3.5402891  0.5695743  0.07206839 -3.048525 #> [3,]  0.9032182  3.54028909  3.1792366  5.8635649  5.80576538 -3.825109 #> [4,]  2.2788794  0.56957431  5.8635649  5.1392279  4.38743342 -3.732373 #> [5,]  2.3818465  0.07206839  5.8057654  4.3874334  3.82545057 -3.499957 #> [6,] -3.7508734 -3.04852467 -3.8251086 -3.7323728 -3.49995655  6.673654 #>  #> $loglik #> [1] 162.2815 #> attr(,"fname") #> fn #> attr(,"method") #> [1] "snewton" #> attr(,"ptype") #> [1] "U" #>  #> $iter #> [1] 8 8 #>
